meanings.definition: The act of moving to a new place.
meanings.sent1: Her relocation to the city brought her closer to her family.
meanings.sent2: The company offered a relocation package to help employees move to the new office.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's relocation to a warmer climate made it the envy of its friends.
meanings.sent4: The relocation of the bookstore to the bustling downtown area breathed new life into the business.
meanings.sent5: The relocation of the playground equipment made the park more enjoyable for children.

meanings.definition: The process of moving something to a different location.
meanings.sent1: The relocation of the furniture was a challenging task.
meanings.sent2: The relocation of the factory to a larger space increased production efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's relocation of acorns to different spots confused the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The relocation of the stars in the night sky mesmerized the stargazers.
meanings.sent5: The relocation of the art pieces to a new gallery enhanced their beauty.
